title: About Time 2 Trade
subtitle: Intraday timing workspace: NY-time session clock with countdowns + Forex Factory-powered economic calendar, custom events, and notifications.

paragraphs: Time 2 Trade is a clean intraday timing workspace for futures and forex day traders. It shows where you are in the trading day (New York, London, Asia sessions) with clear countdowns—then pairs that session context with a Forex Factory-powered economic calendar so you can see scheduled catalysts before they hit.
The goal is simple: reduce timing friction. Less timezone math. Less tab-hopping. Fewer "I forgot CPI was today" moments. More consistent execution decisions.

whatItDoes.title: What Time 2 Trade does
whatItDoes.intro: Time 2 Trade focuses on one job: make the trading day obvious—so you can act (or stand down) with confidence.

features.label: Session clock (NY / London / Asia) with countdowns
features.text: A visual 24-hour clock shows session windows and the countdown to key transitions. This answers "where are we right now?" instantly—without switching tools.

features.label: Forex Factory-powered economic calendar
features.text: See scheduled releases that move price. Filter by impact and currency, and keep your attention on the events that matter to your instruments and strategy.

features.label: Custom events for your personal timing rules
features.text: Add your own events (no-trade windows, routine checkpoints, session reminders, personal rules) so the app matches how you actually trade—not a generic calendar.

features.label: Notifications (where supported)
features.text: Enable reminders for upcoming events and personal checkpoints so you are not surprised by scheduled volatility mid-trade.

features.label: Personalization (optional account)
features.text: Save filters, favorites, and notes when signed in, so your routine stays consistent across devices.

whatItDoes.closing: Time 2 Trade is not a broker, signal tool, or execution platform. It is an awareness layer: sessions + scheduled catalysts + your own timing rules—next to your charts.

audience.title: Who it's built for

items.label: Futures day traders
items.text: If you trade ES/NQ/YM/RTY (or related markets), session timing matters. A clear session clock plus event awareness helps you avoid low-quality timing and sudden volatility windows.

items.label: Forex day traders and scalpers
items.text: Currency-specific filtering helps you focus on what moves your pairs. Session awareness (especially London open and New York open) keeps your routine aligned with liquidity conditions.

items.label: Prop / funded account traders
items.text: Constraint-driven trading demands repeatable routines. Use Time 2 Trade as a fast pre-trade check to avoid rule-breaking entries near major releases.

items.label: Students of session-based frameworks
items.text: If your learning process references "New York time" and session windows, this tool helps you internalize timing patterns through consistent daily use.

items.label: Multi-timezone traders
items.text: If you live outside the U.S. but follow NY-time education and charts, a NY-time-first workflow reduces confusion and improves consistency.

audience.closing: If your process includes session timing, event avoidance, and repeatable daily routines, Time 2 Trade fits naturally.

whyTime.title: Why visualizing time matters
whyTime.intro: Many trading mistakes are timing mistakes—not analysis mistakes. Entering right before a high-impact release, trading through a session transition, or executing during low-liquidity conditions can turn a good setup into a bad trade.

items.label: Session transitions
items.text: Market conditions shift around major opens and closes. Clear countdowns help you avoid entering into unstable transitions.

items.label: Scheduled catalysts
items.text: A strong setup can fail if a major release hits minutes after entry. A clean "what's coming next?" view reduces preventable surprises.

items.label: Routine consistency
items.text: A stable, repeatable pre-trade checklist is a performance advantage—especially in funded environments where discipline matters.

whyTime.closing: Time 2 Trade helps you answer, in real time: "What session am I in, what's coming next, and does this timing match my plan?"

dataSource.title: Data source and reliability
dataSource.intro: Intraday tools are judged on correctness. Session boundaries and event timing must be reliable, especially around DST and date rollovers.

items.label: Economic calendar
items.text: Calendar events are powered by Forex Factory economic event data so traders can reference a familiar source.

items.label: Timezone clarity
items.text: New York time is a common reference for intraday education. The app is designed to keep session and event timing consistent with your selected timezone policy.

items.label: No mixed signals
items.text: The product avoids "signal language." It is built for awareness and timing context—not buy/sell calls.

privacy.title: Privacy, security, and data handling
privacy.intro: Trust matters. Time 2 Trade is designed to be safe by default and minimal in what it stores.

items.label: Guest mode
items.text: Basic preferences can be saved locally on your device for a low-friction first use.

items.label: Account mode
items.text: If you create an account, settings can sync across devices and you can save filters, favorites, notes, and reminders (depending on feature availability).

items.label: No broker connections
items.text: We do not connect to your broker or execute trades.

items.label: No signals
items.text: We do not sell trading signals or "entries."

items.label: No sensitive asks
items.text: We do not require sensitive personal financial information for core functionality.

items.label: Consent-based tracking
items.text: We use Google AdSense for ads and Meta Pixel for conversion tracking. These only activate when you click 'Allow all' on our cookie banner.

items.label: Essential-only option
items.text: Choose 'Essential only' to use the app without advertising cookies or tracking pixels.

items.label: Minimal data collection
items.text: Only what is needed for the feature to work.

items.label: Clear separation
items.text: Public/guest features and account-only features are kept distinct.

items.label: User-first purpose
items.text: Account features exist to improve workflow consistency—not to harvest data.

principles.title: Product principles
principles.intro: Time 2 Trade is built around a few non-negotiables:

items.label: Clarity over complexity
items.text: The UI should answer "what time is it in my trading day?" faster than a calendar tab can load.

items.label: Consistency over novelty
items.text: The same workflow should work daily, especially for prop traders and students building discipline.

items.label: Trust over hype
items.text: No exaggerated promises, no signal claims—just reliable session + event context.

founder.title: A note from the founder
paragraphs: Time 2 Trade is built by an independent software developer focused on practical tools for intraday routines—especially session timing, event awareness, and repeatable daily checklists.
The product is intentionally narrow: it aims to be the timing layer you keep next to your charts, built with a "fast, clean, reliable" mindset rather than feature bloat.

cta.title: Ready to see your trading day clearly?
cta.text: Open the app and answer three questions in seconds: What session am I in? What's the next scheduled catalyst? Does this timing match my plan?
